attributes.action: Get home office to actually read epetitions before rejecting them
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Home Office has continually rejected ePetitions relating to testing on cats under the premise that such a petition exists.

There is NO existing petition objecting to the use of cats alone in animal testing.

We ask the Home Office to actually read ePetitions before rejecting them, rather than using previous cancellation of an ePetition as an excuse to carry on rejecting petitions.

rejection.details:
There is already a petition published under the heading 'Ban testing on animals considered pets in UK' created by Victoria B.  The text of the petition is exactly the same as the text you have used on your recent e-petitions.  That is why your recent e petitions have been considered to be duplicates.

The existing petition currently has 3 signatures and is due to close on 22/7/2013
